alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 4:43PM PDT until March 14 at 10:30PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Eureka CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Navarro River at Navarro affecting Mendocino County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast to begin along portions of Highway 128 late this afternoon and evening. * WHERE...Navarro River at Navarro. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding of Highway 128 approximately 5 miles east of Highway 1 is certain and the road will be closed. Motorists should use alternate routes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 22.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.0 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.7 feet on 02/14/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM PDT.
